title: UConn's Geno Auriemma on podcast: 'Some of our fans are so (expletive) stupid'
text:
Even a five-time national coach of the year, 10-time national champion and recent inductee in the Women's Basketball Hall of Fame and the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame has his critics.
UConn head coach Geno Auriemma fired back at them during a recent podcast with ESPN's Zach Lowe .
A variety of subjects were covered in the podcast, which lasted more than an hour, but some of Auriemma's pointed statements came near the end.
When asked if the "UConn program has become too good," Auriemma did not hold back in his response:
"Some of our fans are so (expletive) stupid it's unbelievable," Auriemma said. "They complain a lot of times that we have no competition and it's boring. Then if we play a really good team and don't play our A-game, they b---- that something's wrong with UConn: 'This kid's not any good. That kid's not any good. Geno Auriemma got outcoached by this coach.' It's unbelievable."
"I heard this WNBA coach say, 'I don't like Connecticut," Auriemma said. "They're bad for the game because they dominate so much. They get the best players and they kill everybody.' And I'm like, 'That's the most idiotic statement I ever heard.' That just goes to show you how ignorant some people are."
Connecticut, led by Syracuse native Breanna Stewart, won a third straight national championship in April.
Auriemma has never been shy with an opinion.
Back in April, he said that the men's game was a "joke."
"I don't coach it," Auriemma said. "I don't play it, so I don't understand the ins and outs of it. But as a spectator watching it, it's a joke. There's only like 10 teams, you know, out of 25, that actually play the kind of game of basketball that you'd like to watch."
UConn makes a stop in Central New York this season. The Huskies play at Colgate on December 9.
